They've been there for a while, but I've only recently starting noticing them as I'm sure they have taken a slight detour from the more traditional adverts for magazines into the slightly surreal - especially as it looks like they are based off an analysis of the pages they display on. So far I've had the slightly ironic Indian matrimonial service ads in threads about abortion, and a slightly bizarre ad for aircraft nose art. 
 
 Currently they want me to donate stem cells...probably from the child I 'm going to have with my Indian bride.

That RealAge ad is beginning to get on my nerves emoticon_angry 
 
 :)
Those ads likely pay a large portion of the bill to be here...I pay nothing...I doubt you do either...I ignore the ads...I doubt you cannot train yourself to do the same.

Those ads likely pay a large portion of the bill to be here...I pay nothing...I doubt you do either...I ignore the ads...I doubt you cannot train yourself to do the same.

 Oh relax for cripes sakes. This is the "fun debates" forum if you didn't notice.

Oh relax for cripes sakes. This is the "fun debates" forum if you didn't notice.
...and I'm relaxed!...and I'm having fun watching people get upset about nothing!
 
 emoticon_xhoho

My point is I wasn't genuinely upset.
 
 I do think Tastyfish's observations about where some of them fell were funny though :)

Before I clicked to post, I saw one that was "Look who the heavens are outsorcing marriage to...Shaadi.com
 
 Sometimes, I have absolutely no idea what is being advertised.
Are there a lot of Indians or Hindus on this site or something?

 Sometimes, I have absolutely no idea what is being advertised.

 
 I was just going to mention that one, that's absolutely fantastic emoticon_xgood Damn you Cells Limited, why can't you be more like Shaadi.com - everyone knows the greatest gift you can give is laughter, most children will cry if you give them frozen stem cells (or they'll eat it).
